material.mattext: Are the conditions which allow us to safely use the z-test met? Support your answer with appropriate graphs, if needed.

There are two conditions we need to check: (i) The sample is random. (ii) We are not told whether pregnancy length varies normally, so in order to check whether the sample size (n=25) is large enough to ensure that the Central Limit Theorem "kicks in" we would need to look at the data using a histogram and verify that it does not display extreme skewedness and/or outliers. Here is the histogram of the data. In fact, the data display very slight right skewedness and no outliers, so n=25 should be more than enough.
